remarks.format:
## 解説 In Visual Basic, you should use this attribute to create an extension method. For more information, see [Extension Methods \(Visual Basic\)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/b8020aae-374d-46a9-bcb7-8cc2390b93b6).
In C\#, you do not need to use this attribute; you should use the [this \(C\# Reference\)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/d4f827fe-4710-410b-89b8-867dad44b8a3) modifier for the first parameter to create an extension method. The compiler automatically emits **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** for extension methods. For more information, see [Extension Methods \(C\# Programming Guide\)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/175ce3ff-9bbf-4e64-8421-faeb81a0bb51).
If you are writing a compiler that supports extension methods, your compiler should emit this attribute on each extension method and on each class and assembly that contains one or more extension methods.
